channel.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!
channel.description:
Hey, I finally got my server up and running and i log on to find i have dragon claws on there and everything.. But i have no Dragon Boots.
Could anyone please try and explain to me how i would go about adding these items to my server please: -Dragon Boots -Skill Capes -Vesta Longsword -Statius Warhammer
Thanks to anyone that can help, I'm very new to coding and trying to teach myself so all the help i could get would be great.
Thankyou, Jake :D

item.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

No, the id will be in the class8

Read full topic

And do i have to do every skillcape seperate?

item.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“jake_93, post:21, topic:286197”]So right… so im not confused.

The code goes in class8.java underneath all the other codes.
The 2 models go in the model folder (They should be named the right codes)

And then what i do in server thing so i can weild/use the items?[/quote]Just type Add models in game and then logg out compile your client and source re-start it and there ya’ go

item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“r34p4g3pk, post:19, topic:286197”][quote author=Natey link=topic=378530.msg2847130#msg2847130 date=1246342069]

[quote author=r34p4g3pk link=topic=378530.msg2847122#msg2847122 date=1246341828]

[quote author=Natey link=topic=378530.msg2847118#msg2847118 date=1246341673]

[quote author=heroisgay link=topic=378530.msg2847117#msg2847117 date=1246341536]

[quote author=Natey link=topic=378530.msg2847115#msg2847115 date=1246341411]

K thnx, im acting off memory here since all of my files were deleted & im on someone elses labtop.
[/quote]l33ch3r pl0x

How am i leeching anything…i meant i was giving advice from my own memory since i havent actually touched a source in ages.
[/quote]Ahh, shit you don’t get it, your on someone else’s laptop…
[/quote]I don’t see how being on someones computer is leeching. By the way Mr. English, it’s Else’s.
[/quote]I don’t capatialize else’s, do I?
[/quote]I can see that, you can’t spell capitalize right either.[/quote]I never use those words, so I don’t really know how to spell them, and it took you long enough to reply, looked on an e-dictionary?

item.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

[quote=“heroisgay, post:6, topic:286197”][quote author=r34p4g3pk link=topic=378530.msg2847101#msg2847101 date=1246340940]
Okay, well use the search bar and type in “Dragon Boots model,” etc and then download them and place them into your models folder.
To get them to show up and allow you to wear them, look in your client folder and find class8.java, and with your other ints add this one;

} if(i == 2904) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 4678; class8.anInt181 = 595; class8.anInt190 = 0; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt199 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 4679; class8.anInt200 = 4680; class8.anInt175 = 56; class8.anInt197 = 116; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Dragon Boots"; class8.aByteArray178 = "These will protect my feet.".getBytes(); It’s up to you to find the rest of the ints, like i said use the search bar.
[/quote]

Ahh int, that’s the word i was looking for. After you add the models & ints to your client you have to add them to your source so you weild them correctly. I havent looked at a source file in months but i believe its in your item.java, and i think i remember something about server.java.

What he had in the ‘code’ are what you call ints. You add them in your class8 file.[/quote]Adding models and making them work in game correctly has nothing to do with server.java ;).

Read full topic
item.source: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!

item.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!

[quote=“jake_93, post:5, topic:286197”]I hear i need 2 models, One wearing and one on the ground… is this correct?
And ints…? im so sorry but as i sed ive never coded befour so ull have to bare with my nooby questions

Jake :D[/quote]First off, learn proper English, second off use the damn search bar, don’t look through one page and say “oh sh1tz i r cantz find it :(” actually look around, it’s amazing what you can find when you actually look around a tad bit.

Read full topic
item.source: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!

item.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

[quote=“r34p4g3pk, post:4, topic:286197”]Okay, well use the search bar and type in “Dragon Boots model,” etc and then download them and place them into your models folder.
To get them to show up and allow you to wear them, look in your client folder and find class8.java, and with your other ints add this one;

} if(i == 2904) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 4678; class8.anInt181 = 595; class8.anInt190 = 0; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt199 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 4679; class8.anInt200 = 4680; class8.anInt175 = 56; class8.anInt197 = 116; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Dragon Boots"; class8.aByteArray178 = "These will protect my feet.".getBytes(); It’s up to you to find the rest of the ints, like i said use the search bar.[/quote]

Ahh int, that’s the word i was looking for. After you add the models & ints to your client you have to add them to your source so you weild them correctly. I havent looked at a source file in months but i believe its in your item.java, and i think i remember something about server.java.

What he had in the ‘code’ are what you call ints. You add them in your class8 file.

Read full topic

item.source: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!

item.title: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Okay, well use the search bar and type in “Dragon Boots model,” etc and then download them and place them into your models folder.
To get them to show up and allow you to wear them, look in your client folder and find class8.java, and with your other ints add this one;

} if(i == 2904) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 4678; class8.anInt181 = 595; class8.anInt190 = 0; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt199 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 4679; class8.anInt200 = 4680; class8.anInt175 = 56; class8.anInt197 = 116; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Dragon Boots"; class8.aByteArray178 = "These will protect my feet.".getBytes(); It’s up to you to find the rest of the ints, like i said use the search bar. You don’t really need to do anything server sided basically all you need to do is add them into your item.cfg and depending on whatever base your using make them wearable by adding the item id into item.java/item2.java, like i said depends on your base.

Read full topic
item.source: Help: Dragon Boots, Vesta longsword, Statius Warhammer and Skillcapes!

Jake
